definition: a way out (lit. and fig.)/opportunity for advancement/a way forward/outlet (for one's products)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Another career path for teachers focuses on education administration.
sentences.chinese: 教師工作的另一個出路就是教育管理。

sentences.english: Analysis gave her an outlet to discuss her problems with schizophrenia.
sentences.chinese: 分析給她一個討論她精神分裂症的出路。

sentences.english: We must strive for peace with ISIS, it's the only way.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須於伊希斯爭取和平，這是唯一的出路。

sentences.english: Beauvoir appeals women to seek their fortune in difficulties in "the second sex".
sentences.chinese: 波伏娃在《第二性》中呼籲女性在困境中尋找出路。

sentences.english: Supply and install clarifier sludge outlet sluice valves.
sentences.chinese: 供應及安裝淨化污泥出路水閘閥門。

sentences.english: The author discussed how to sort out domestic sewage in city proper from the angle of cancelling septic tank.
sentences.chinese: 文章從取消化糞池的角度探討城區生活污水的出路。

sentences.english: Only do it, the Chinese Public Administration has a good o…
sentences.chinese: 只有這樣，中國行政學纔會有一條好的出路。

sentences.english: The fundamental way out lies in reform and openness.
sentences.chinese: 根本出路在於改革開放。

sentences.english: Spending less money is the obvious answer to his financial problem.
sentences.chinese: 他經濟困難，明擺著的出路是少花錢。

sentences.english: South to work, school trackless recruitment seems to be the only way people can go nowhere else.
sentences.chinese: 南下打工，似乎是求學無路招工無門的人的惟一出路。

sentences.english: Inquired into the measure increased economy benefit, settle a way out for sunds difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 探討了提高經濟效益的措施，解決經費困難的出路。

sentences.english: Corn and sugar beets could be the future.
sentences.chinese: 玉米和糖用甜菜可能是未來的出路。

sentences.english: Now, as if by the will of God, the solution had presented itself.
sentences.chinese: 但現在，如有神助，出路自動顯現在他面前。

sentences.english: It take effort to find a way out.
sentences.chinese: 我花了很大得勁才找到出路。

sentences.english: The physical seems to be no way out.
sentences.chinese: 方天翼似乎沒有出路了。

sentences.english: The people became desperate in their attempt to find a way out.
sentences.chinese: 人們拼死試圖找到出路。

definition: broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
way of doing sth/the right social connection
settle down and get on with one's pursuit
this road is blocked/fig. This method does not work./Doing this is no good.
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
